title: Print, August 22, 1874
medium: Wood engraving on off-white wove paper
signed: Signed on block at end of log, lower right: WH; and again on block, lower right: LAGARDE Sc.
inscribed: Caption: WAITING FOR A BITE. - (DRAWN BY WINSLOW HOMER.)
description: Three boys are seated on a tree trunk which has fallen over a stream.  In the center, one boy is fishing, while another watches.  The third boy, on the right, baits his line.  Forest in background.  Possibly located at Keene Valley in the Adirondacks.  Information from Linda S. Ferber, Barbara Dayer Gallati, Marilyn S. Kushner, Winslow Homer: Illustrating America (New York, NY: George Braziller in association with Brooklyn Museum of Art, 2000), 63.

exhibitions.title: Frederic Church, Winslow Homer & Thomas Moran: Tourism and the American Landscape

tombstone.epitaph:
Print, August 22, 1874.
August 22, 1874. Wood engraving on off-white wove paper. Gift of Arthur B. Carlson. 1951-93-15.
